definition: to quarrel/to make a noise/noisy/to disturb by making a noise
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke

sentences.english: They wrangled and rowed with other passengers.
sentences.chinese: 他们与其他旅客争辨吵闹。

sentences.english: The turbulent meeting ended in a fist fight.
sentences.chinese: 吵闹的会议最终以拳脚相向而结束。

sentences.english: Of insects in the windrows of the hay.
sentences.chinese: 在干草中嗡嗡不息的吵闹？

sentences.english: You know I hate the crowded and clamorous cities.
sentences.chinese: 你知道我很讨厌拥挤而且吵闹的城市。

sentences.english: He stood back and just watched as she birthed her baby without fuss or noise.
sentences.chinese: 他往后站，只是看着她生孩子，没有慌乱或吵闹。

sentences.english: The noisier they were, the happier was their mother.
sentences.chinese: 孩子越吵闹，他们的母亲就越高兴。

sentences.english: Liz doesn't enjoy romps as much as other girls do.
sentences.chinese: 莉兹不像别的女孩那样喜欢嬉戏吵闹。

sentences.english: The goose heard the racket and she, too, started hollering.
sentences.chinese: 那只母鹅也听到吵闹声，便对韦伯大喊起来。

sentences.english: Poltergeists are usually associated with an individual.
sentences.chinese: 吵闹鬼通常是和个人有关。

sentences.english: Marman also was booked for resisting arrest after a fracas with an arresting officer.
sentences.chinese: 马曼也因与逮捕他的警官吵闹而被控以拒捕罪。

sentences.english: The children get very rumbustious after tea.
sentences.chinese: 吃茶点后，孩子们变得很吵闹。

sentences.english: Those children are always quarreling among themselves .
sentences.chinese: 那些小孩子互相间老是吵吵闹闹。

sentences.english: The young men had nothing better to do than fracas in the streets.
sentences.chinese: 这个年轻人除了在街上吵闹，一无是处。

sentences.english: OK, everyone. Less noise, please! Gather round and listen carefully.
sentences.chinese: 大家注意，请不要吵闹，围成圈认真听我说。

sentences.english: Some students heard the noise and gathered around us.
sentences.chinese: 有些学生听到吵闹声围过来看。

sentences.english: Our soy formula proven to reduce fussiness and gas.
sentences.chinese: 我们的豆奶配方奶粉可以减少宝宝的吵闹和胀气。

definition: to shout and scream (idiom); to kick up a fuss/to make a scene
to make a lot of noise/to be disorderly
to dispute/to disagree/to argue opinionatedly/to wrangle
to quarrel/to make a noise/noisy/to disturb by making a noise
to disturb/to create confusion/to make a din
to quarrel/to have a row/quarrel/CL:頓|顿[dun4]
shouting and screaming (idiom); to scream loudly/to rant/to kick up a racket/to conduct vigorous propaganda
